title: The Block's Mitch and Mark warn rivals it's GAME ON after they were blocked from putting in a spa
text:
The Block's Mitch and Mark didn't mince words while ranting about their competitors on Monday's episode.

After the duo were blocked from putting a spa in their pad, they called a body corporate meeting on site to vent their frustrations, declaring it would be war from now on.

At one point, a furious Mitch said to camera that if any teams need any help in future, 'it will be a big fat go f**k yourself!'

'It will be a big fat go f**k yourself!' The Block's Mitch (L) and Mark (R) warned their rivals it's GAME ON after they were blocked from putting in a spa in their luxury pad on Monday... as the other teams battle to complete their build

'We asked you for some help, you said no,' Mitch began.

'So now going forward, if somebody else needs a waterproofer, a tiler or has ran out of something they need to get across the line, it will be a big fat go f**k yourself!'

At the body corporate meeting, Mark told the teams: 'I guess is decision is based on ''we want to win and we don't want you to win," we we will certainly be playing hard for the next five weeks.'

It's on! At the body corporate meeting, Mark told the teams: 'I guess is decision is based on ''we want to win and we don't want you to win," we we will certainly be playing hard for the next five weeks'

Jesse and Mel had voted against the pair putting in a spa, while the other teams remained undecided because they wanted to talk to their real estate agents to see if it would affect the price of their properties.

Tess and Luke were concerned that the wall for the spa would block the view from their home, and subsequently asked to see more plans.

Mitch and Mark said they were annoyed because they had supported another teams' plans at a previous body corporate meeting.

Their verdict: Jesse and Mel (L) had voted against the pair putting in a spa because the show is a competition. Tess and Luke (R) were concerned that the wall for the spa would block their views from their home, so asked to see more plans

'Is that a threat?' Deb said to camera after the meeting.

She added: 'This is not a spite thing, nobody is doing this 'cause we want to stop them having a spa. We want to preserve our own properties!'

Prior to the body corporate meeting, El'ise had even broken down in tears after hearing about Mitch and Mark's desire to put in a spa.
description: The Block's Mitch and Mark warned their rivals that it's game on during Monday's show, after they were blocked - for the time being - from putting a spa in their pad.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
